column5: Hello guys, I am trying to find the name of a lake for a northern pike ice fishing trip.  I know the lake is near Atikokan, Ontario.  I also know the lake is deep and clear, with big shallow bays connected to the main lake basin.  I know there are lake trout and northern pike but not sure of other species.  Can anyone help?
I know that area like the back of my hand, but you just described almost every single lake in the immediate vicinity  . If you can get a little more specific I can most likely help.

I really wish I had more info....I think it's primarily known as a lake trout lake. From looking at a map I was thinking it was Marmion Lake....would that be right?  I'm basically looking for a lake that I can do some tip up fishing for trophy northerns.....is there a better choice that anyone may know of?
Post a picture of the map. Perhaps someone can identify it, if they see its location.  Regards, Snowball
I don't even have that.....sorry.  I just looked on mapquest and the only big lake I see near Atikokan is Marmion Lake.  I apologize for being so vague....I wish I had more information.
Could it be White Otter Lake??
I think it might be Clearwater West.  Has anyone fished this lake?  I think it's about 30 minutes or so to the northwest of Antikokan.

There's a lodge on Clearwater (http://www.brownsclearwaterlodge.com/)  I know it's deep & clear and has lakers.  White Otter Lake also has lakers....White Otter is a beautiful lake.  We vacationed up there last summer on Turtle Lake, and spent a day with a tour guide visiting WOL, the castle, and looking at pictographs.  Just some amazing country up there....  Best of luck... dk
The locals call marmion lake, The floodwaters and yes there are fish  blair
